title: Sitzler wins contract to build new bridges on Roper Highway in Australia
text:
Sitzler wins contract to build new bridges on Roper Highway in Australia 14 October 2015 
Sitzler has received a contract to start construction of two new bridges at Roper River and Wilton River on Roper Highway in the Northern Territory of Australia. 
Under the contract, whose value remains undisclosed, the company will also carry out road upgrades and reconstruct 7.3km of approach roads, including a realigned section of the Roper Highway. 
The project is anticipated to improve access to local communities, such as the Ngukurr and Numbulwar by reducing future closure times at the crossings. 
Northern Territory transport minister Peter Chandler said: "On-site activities will start this month, with major works to commence in April 2016 following the wet-season. "On-site activities will start this month, with major works to commence in April 2016 following the wet-season." 
"Sitzler will manage delivery of the project and are focused on increasing indigenous employment through release of small works packages aimed at indigenous business enterprises and local contractors." 
The existing Roper River and Wilton River crossings are bed-level crossings, which are said to be prone to flooding during the wet-season, making the highway impassable for a significant portion of the year. 
The Roper Highway project is a jointly funded project with the Australian Government contributing A$32m ($23.5m), while the Northern Territory Government will provide A$8m ($5.8m). 
Australian Deputy Prime Minister and infrastructure and regional development minister Warren Truss said the project forms part of the regional roads productivity package under the infrastructure investment programme. 
Truss said "The Australian Government is contributing $32 million to the project, which is part of the regional roads productivity package under the infrastructure investment programme." Follow Us:
